item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Cleaned up this thread, nickypie if you continue to break the rules like you’ve done several times in this thread you will be infracted. Ridiculous that you think you can talk about payments and then continue to flame someone.

@OP, I have a topic stickied in this board, take a look in there.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help making a site

item.title: Need some help making a site
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

He hasn’t said that he wants to make money, nickypie. He’s asked how to make a website.
Nicksworld, I’d suggest that you start by looking into basic HTML and once you’ve learned that look into CSS. You’ll need to use HTML to structure your page and CSS to style it in a way that you like. When you’ve got a site design done (If you don’t want to design the whole site, there are many free templates which you can use. However, you’ll still need CSS and HTML knowledge in order to make any edits you like) then you can look into adding functionality such as a webclient.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help making a site
